intro: Mitreola lincangensis, commonly known as the Lincang mitreola, is a small, herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
